actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 1 of H. Res. 1230. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on December 12, 2022.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Con. Res. 121 — "Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of the bill H.R. 7776."
Mr. Smith (WA) asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 406
actions-list.actionItem: 8 (Roll no. 517).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 1617 — "To modify the requirements for the Administrator of the Small Business Administration relating to declaring a disaster in a rural area, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass S. 1617 which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 350
actions-list.actionItem: 80 (Roll no. 516).
The House resumed with debate on H. Res. 1512.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 3316, and S. 4577.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1512.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Smith (WA) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 1512 — "Providing for the concurrence by the House in the Senate amendment to H.R. 7776, with an amendment."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

actions-list.header: On motion to adjourn Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 129

actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to table the motion to reconsider the vote Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224

actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Cicilline moved to table the motion to reconsider the vote
Perlmutter moved to reconsider the vote on agreeing to the Senate amendment to H.R. 8404.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table. Objection heard.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 258
actions-list.actionItem: 169, 1 Present (Roll no. 513).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1510, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the Nadler motion to concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. 8404.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1510, Mr. Nadler moved that the House agree to the Senate amendment.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Spanberger to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ritchie Torres to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
